CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: It was also found that the blend films of PIDT - EHNT , PIDT - DTNT , and PIDT-C12NT with PC71BM showed surface roughness with rootmean - square ( rms ) of 4.0 , 2.6 , and 0.4 nm , respectively. As film morphology plays a critical role in charge transport , the smoother blend film based on PIDT-C12NT that present more favorable morphological features , may effectively reduce charge recombination and traps , and thereby potentially lead to higher J sc and fill factor ( FF ) than the other two polymers. Photovoltaic Properties. The photovoltaic properties of the resulting polymers were investigated with a conventional device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 40 nm ) / polym e r : P C 7^1 B M ( 8^0 n m ) / p o l y [ ( 9 , 9 -b i s ( 3 ′ -( N , Ndimethylamino)propyl)-2,7-fluorene)-alt-2,7-(9,9-dioctylfluorene) ] ( PFN ) ( 5 nm ) / Al ( 100 nm ) , here a thin layer of PFN was employed as the cathode interlayer since it can improve the electron extraction. 56-58 We chose PC71BM as the acceptor because it had much stronger absorption in the visible region than PC61BM , which can complement the absorption valley of the polymers and beneficial for high - efficiency PSCs. 59 The BHJ photoactive layer was prepared by spin - coating chlorobenzene solution of the polymer : PC71BM with weight ratio of 1 : 2 on the top of PEDOT : PSS layer without further treatment. The tests were performed under the illumination of AM 1.5G , 100 mW cm^-2 with an active of area of 0.16 cm^2. The J-V characteristics are shown in Figure 6a and the parameters of J sc , V oc , FF and PCE of the resulting PSCs are summarized in Table 2. It was found that all PSC devices based on these polymers demonstrated relative high V oc of ca. 0.8 - 0.9 V , which benefited from the deep HOMO levels. Device based on PIDT - EHNT obtained a low PCE of 1.49% , with a J sc of 4.33 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.86 V and a FF of 40% . Slightly improved device performance was realized based on PIDT - DTNT , which exhibited a V oc of 0.80 V , a FF of 45% , but a dramatically improved J sc of 8.26 mA cm^-2 , leading to a moderate PCE of 2.97% . Best device performance with a PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT , which showed further improved J sc of 10.21 mA cm^-2 , a V oc of 0.90 V and a FF of 55% .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PC71BM |
| PFN |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| ITO |
| Al |
| Chlorobenzene |
| AM 1.5G |

Note:

* PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are the names of the polymers used in the study.
* PC71BM is the name of the acceptor material used in the study.
* PFN is the name of the cathode interlayer material used in the study.
* PEDOT and PSS are the names of the materials used in the device structure.
* ITO and Al are the names of the materials used in the device structure.
* Chlorobenzene is the solvent used to dissolve the polymer in the spin-coating process.
* AM 1.5G is the light source used in the experiments.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PC71BM |

Note:

* PIDT-EHNT, PIDT-DTNT, and PIDT-C12NT are the names of the polymers used in the study.
* PC71BM is the name of the acceptor material used in the study.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| rootmean - square (rms) |
| J sc |
| V oc |
| FF |
| PCE |
| HOMO levels |

Note: HOMO levels is not a property name, but it is a term used to describe the energy level of the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) in a material, which is relevant to the performance of organic solar cells.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 4.0 nm | Root-mean-square (rms) surface roughness of PIDT-EHNT blend film |
| 2.6 nm | Root-mean-square (rms) surface roughness of PIDT-DTNT blend film |
| 0.4 nm | Root-mean-square (rms) surface roughness of PIDT-C12NT blend film |

| 5 nm | Thickness of PFN layer |
| 100 nm | Thickness of Al layer |
| 1:2 | Weight ratio of polymer:PC71BM in BHJ photoactive layer |
| 0.16 cm^2 | Active area of the device |
| 100 mW cm^-2 | Illumination intensity |
| AM 1.5G | Spectral distribution of the illumination |
| 0.8-0.9 V | Range of Voc values for all PSC devices |
| 4.33 mA cm^-2 | Jsc of device based on PIDT-EHNT |
| 0.86 V | Voc of device based on PIDT-EHNT |
| 40% | FF of device based on PIDT-EHNT |
| 1.49% | PCE of device based on PIDT-EHNT |
| 8.26 mA cm^-2 | Jsc of device based on PIDT-DTNT |
| 0.80 V | Voc of device based on PIDT-DTNT |

| 5.05% | PCE of device based on PIDT-C12NT |
